intro: Weingartia alba, commonly known as the white weingartia, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for succulent enthusiasts.
